channel.title: How to Rotate a Model
channel.description:
ok this is driving me crazy.
how do you rotate the banker or any other model? or can you?
im using richscape server/client
did i mention i have searched and searched for a tut or a forum/thread [br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 10, 2008, 11:59:38 am[/size][hr]still no answer? is this even possible? or is it some ridiculously hard redoing the entire server.java file?

item.title: How to Rotate a Model
item.dc:creator: @cloudscape cloudscape
item.description:
@cloudscape wrote:

Your welcome, glad to help.

Read full topic

item.title: How to Rotate a Model
item.dc:creator: @Darkness_Pk Darkness Pk
item.description:
@Darkness_Pk wrote:

[quote=“DJAlup, post:4, topic:249887”][quote author=Darkness Pk link=topic=329431.msg2575316#msg2575316 date=1228933224]
Well from what I get from your question.

Rotating an object is possible, after the coordinates there are some 0´s than the one before the last.
Is mostly different than the object above or beneath, change that one to what you need.
about a NPC idk
[/quote]

well those zeros after the item/npc are there x/y cords not the rotation i tried that allready[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 10, 2008, 12:52:12 pm[/size][hr][quote author=cloudscape link=topic=329431.msg2575350#msg2575350 date=1228934951]
For objects to change to way they are facing you use this part of the code:

makeGlobalObject(XXXX, YYYY, ID, Face, Type);

The face is the direction that the object faces, the values for this are, 0,-1,-2,-3
I will let you work out which is which

Eg code.

makeGlobalObject(XXXX, YYYY, 1000, -3, 10);

The last number always has to be 10.

Hope this helped
[/quote]

thank you soo much, i looked and looked for a tut and couldn’t find one![/quote]

Read more I said same geez Ppl need to many glasses these days

Read full topic

The face is the direction that the object faces, the values for this are, 0,-1,-2,-3
I will let you work out which is which

Eg code.

makeGlobalObject(XXXX, YYYY, 1000, -3, 10);

The last number always has to be 10.

Hope this helped[/quote]

thank you soo much, i looked and looked for a tut and couldn’t find one!

item.title: How to Rotate a Model
item.dc:creator: @cloudscape cloudscape
item.description:
@cloudscape wrote:

For objects to change to way they are facing you use this part of the code:

makeGlobalObject(XXXX, YYYY, ID, Face, Type);

The face is the direction that the object faces, the values for this are, 0,-1,-2,-3
I will let you work out which is which

Eg code.

makeGlobalObject(XXXX, YYYY, 1000, -3, 10);

The last number always has to be 10.

Hope this helped
